ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: One thousand and eight fifty women benefited from micro-credit programmes registered under Mutually Aided Cooperative Society MACTS in ten Mandals of Guntur District One hundred Women in difficult circumstances at SWADHAR Home, Tenali and 60 trafficked women at Ujjawala Home, Nambur are rehabilitated in different levels-Education, Health, Social and Livelihood 180 SHG Women were trained under MEDP training of NABARD Skill development for sustainable livelihoods Nearly 100 Installation of Borewells, Mineral Water plant in the villages of Guntur Construction of 200 Toilets under sanitation programme in the villages of Guntur Creating awareness on Tree plantation and Kitchen Garden 199 children and youngsters with disability were extended rehabilitation in Health, Education, Social and Livelihood Childrens Parliaments were formed in 5 of our operational areas namely Thangellamudi, Nambur, Kakani and Sattenapalli others areas it is under process Organised special input sessions on International Womens day, International Water Day, International Widows Day, International day of Girl Child etc 260 rural youth benefited from the skill development and Job placement program in Sambalpur and Guntur

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Standard of English among High school students has been significantly improved. The pass percentage in English Subject and thereby overall pass percentage in X Class Public examination has been improved from 74.6 percent in 2010 to 96.4 in 2017. Scores of individual students have been improved remarkably and more number of students secured GPAs 10, 9.8 and 9.7 out of 10. In the year 2019 all the students who secured admissions in IIITs in AP are from Government Schools only.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Pass Percentage of students appeared in X Class public examination in Srikakulam District has been remarkably improved from 74.6% in 2010 to 96% in 2018. This was possible by the efforts to improve the standards of English language and by proving good study material - Model Papers for X Class public Examination to the individual students. The annual expenditure was Rs.3,17,441/-. Rs. 2,50,000/- was contributed by the managing Trustee. Rest by other Trustees and Patrons.

To Promote education among rural students in Srikakulam District of Andhra Pradesh, which is a most backward district in the state. Most of the students don’t have sufficient foundation in English Language and they are very week in communication. Our Trust has provided Grammar DVDs, Spoken English DVDs and Grammar Workbooks to 474 Government High Schools at a cost of Rs. 4,23,151/-. Managing Trusty has contributed Rs. 3,75,000/- and the rest by other Trustees.

To improve the standard of English Language among High School students; to improve the pass percentage and individual scores in the X Class public examination. Model Question papers X Class Public Exam were provided to 290 students in 50 schools in 6 Mandals. 40 inch TVs were provided in 2 schools to use them as computer screens. Rs. 70,000/- Scholarships were provided to needy students. The annual expenditure was Rs. 2,35,281/-. The Managing Trustee contributed Rs. 1,50,000/-.

It is heartening to note that over the past 8 years the pass percentage of X Class Public Examination has been improving consistently and individual scores of the students have been improved remarkably. All the students who secured admission in the IIITs of AP are from Government Schools only. Model papers were supplied to 1672 students from 210 schools at a cost of about Rs 4,00,000/- . The managing Trustee contributed Rs.2,50,000/- and the remaining bu other Trustees and Patrons.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Peddalanka is a small island habitation with 126 families. Majority of the families belong to SC (120) and most backward caste communities (6). Most of them depend on farming occupations, labour works, cattle care and other supporting occupations. Unemployment, seasonal employment and irregular income source is hampering the lives of the poor and marginalized. Their economic conditions also not allowed thinking about alternative solutions for income generation. People are not organized.

TO PROMOTE LIVELIHOOD ENHANCEMENT AND INCOME GENERATION FOR WOMEN, LANDLESS, AND SMALL FARMERS THROUGH LIVESTOCK PROMOTION, FODDER DEVELOPMENT AND APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGIES. TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY HEALTH CARE, SANITARY CONDITIONS BY CONSTRUCTING TOILETS, BIO-GAS UNITS AND VEGETABLE/FRUIT TREE GARDENING PROMOTION. TO ENHANCE AND UP-GRADATION OF TECHNOLOGICAL SKILLS FOR YOUTH AND WOMEN FOR EMPLOYMENT GENERATION.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ Education to about 3000 Children belonging to Yanadi, Erukula, Lambada / Sugali, Mondi Banda, Budiga Jangalu (Fortune Tellers), Fishermen Habitations and other Backward Communities by establishing Primary Schools in the identified colonies by building school sheds, providing full-time teachers, Lunch, Medical Aid, Clothing (Uniform & Colour Dress), Books, Stationery, Footwear, School Bags, Daily Newspaper to the colony etc. â€¢ House Site of 4 Acres and 87 Homes to Budiga Jangalu in 75 Thallur â€¢ 175 Yanadi families in Doppalapudi, Ganapavaram, Nandayapalem, Pedapalakalur, Chinamakkena, Ponugupadu â€¢ House Sites to 12 families of Mondi Bandollu in Amaravathi Chenchu Colony â€¢ Installation of Smokeless Choolas in Budigajangalu colony â€¢ Installation of Parabolic Solar Cookers in Yanadi colonies â€¢ 40 families of Chenchus in Kakirala â€¢ Proposed assistance to 500 families of Fishermen community â€¢ Platform for Fishermen at Nakshatranagar HIV/ AIDS Programme: Karmika Vidya Peet is supporting people affected with HIV/AIDS. This programme was started with 36 victims in 2009 by 2015 it reaches to 110 people from different areas of Guntur Dist which includes men, women and children providing monthly financial assistance for nutrition and medical checkups. KVP conducted get-together meetings monthly for all these victims to establish solidarity among them and strengthen them both physically and psychologically through guiding them in nutritional and health aspects and also restoring hope and moral strength through motivation and awareness.

Lambadi is a special kind of dance of Andhra Pradesh. In this form of dance, mainly the female dancers dance in tune with the male drummers to offer homage to their Lord for a good harvest. At Anupu Village near Nagarjunakonda, Lambadi dance originated. They are actually semi-nomadic tribes who are gradually moving towards civilization and decency. This dance is mainly restricted among the females and rarely the males participate in Lambadi Dance.

“Traffic-Rules” provide systematic and controlled measures that a person needs to take on the road for safely reaching his or her destination.When road safety products are utilized correctly or efficiently, they can help save lives, prevent accidents and injuries, and keep a society functioning in the most optimal way.

An electric folk dance form, Dollu refers to the drum and Kunitha means dance in Kannada. Originally this was a very popular entertainment for village folks, in the days when television did not exist. Every hamlet or village had a Dollu Kunitha; most have one even today. A team consists of 12-14 dancers with one central singer-cum-director who has one metal instrument that he uses to set rhythm.
